stages.logText: In the devastated lands south of Stoutford, I found an ominous stone etched with strange symbols.
As I touched its glowing mark, an unnatural chill ran through me, and I heard a voice in my mind, calling out for help. It spoke of torment and told me to return to Crossglen to find answers.
The presence of the mark grows unbearable. I feel an overwhelming pull to return to Crossglen. There is something wrong, and I sense it's tied to my father. I must hurry to see what's happening.
I spoke to father. He assured me he's fine, but mentioned Leta hasn't been herself lately. She's been pacing her home and muttering to herself. I should check on her and see what's going on.
When I confronted Leta, she seemed different--angrier, more agitated. As I pressed her, a dark spirit suddenly manifested before me and attacked.

I defeated the Dark spirit, but it didn't feel like the end. The Dark spirit trapped inside Leta has fled back to the devastated lands south of Stoutford, where its power seems to grow stronger. I need to return there and finish what I started.

In the depths of the devastated lands south of Stoutford, I found the dark spirit waiting for me. It was stronger this time, but I defeated it once and for all. Whatever bond it had with me and Leta is broken. I should check-up on Leta again.

I returned to Crossglen to find everything changed. Leta has aged decades in an instant. Her child is now fully grown, and her timid husband, Oromir, seems like a different man entirely. They remember nothing of what happened. The spirit may be gone, but its curse has left a permanent mark on the lives it touched.

I encountered Vaelric, a reclusive healer living in the swamp between Mt. Galmore and Stoutford. He refused to help me unless I dealt with a dangerous creature corrupting his medicinal pools
I defeated the monstrous creature that I found on Vaelric's land. This creature was enormous and venomous, feeding on the lifeblood of the swamp.
Vaelric rewarded me for my efforts by teaching me how to use leeches to heal bleeding wounds. He warned me to save them for dire situations and respect their power.
After I mentioned to Vaelric that the graveyard near the Galmore encampment has a dug-up grave plot, he asked me to investigate it, but I declined. I told him I was tired of helping the pathetic.
After I mentioned to Vaelric that the graveyard near the Galmore encampment has a dug-up grave plot, he asked me to investigate it. I agreed to look for clues.
In the graveyard, I found a bell attached to a broken rope. It was partially buried and covered by grass, but I retrieved it.
I discovered a music box in the graveyard. Like the bell, it was partially buried and obscured by grass.
I discovered the skeletal remains of a human beneath a covering of grass and weeds. I wonder if it related to why that grave plot is dug up?
I brought the bell and music box to the Galmore encampment and encountered a ghost named Eryndor told me the items were his. I gave them to him in exchange for being "friends".
Eryndor revealed to me that he is the one haunting Vaelric.
Eryndor told me his story and said he would leave Vaelric alone if I returned his ring.
[EiH]Vaelric has told me his side of the story. [Add more details later.]
[JiS]After hearing Eryndor's story, I decided that he has been wronged. I also agreed to get his ring back from Vaelric.
[EiH, BG]I informed Vaelric of the ghost's terms, and he agreed. He also gave me Eryndor's ring and now I should return it to Eryndor.
[JiS]I've stolen the ring from Vaelric's attic.
[JiS]I lied to Vaelric as I informed him that I was not able to find any clues surrounding the grave site or anywhere else.
[JiS]I brought the ring back to Eryndor. Vaelric received no relief from the haunting.
[EiH]I brought the ring back to Eryndor and he agreed to stop haunting Vaelric.
[EiH]Vaelric rewarded me by offering to make Insectbane Tonics if I bring him the right ingredients.

I need to bring Vaelric the following ingredients  in order for him to make his "Insectbane Tonic": Five Duskbloom flowers, Five Mosquito Proboscises, Five bottles of swamp water and One sample of Mudfiend Goo.
[BG]I brought the ring back to Eryndor just to tell him that I've decided to keep it.
[BG]When I refused to return the ring, Eryndor attacked me.
[BG]I defeated Eryndor and prevented the hauntings of Vaelric...for now, but I feel that they will resume someday.
[EiH]Vaelric is now able to mix up some Insectbane Tonic for me.

[BG]I've informed Vaelric that I defeated Eryndor but was not able to promise an end to the hauntings, Vaelric was dissatisfied with me and the outcome even going as far as saying that Andor is a better person than I am.
